bibl.title: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 28, [1895]

div1.p: Lazear describes a trip to Fontainebleau, in France. He mistakenly wrote "1894" as the year on the letter.

div1.head: Letter from Jesse W. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, June 28, [1895]
div1.p:
I forgot
to fill my pen before
leaving Paris therefore
I have only the hotel pen.

I reached Fontainebleau
yesterday afternoon after
two days of very
pleasant walking in
spite of the heat.

The roads are very good
and there are nearly
always broad grass-grown
spaces on each side
with two rows of
trees. The forest and
chateau here are very
beautiful but I think
I shall start on again
tomorrow morning
I shall go to Moret
then to Marlotte and
after that probably
to Orleans but I am
not sure as I may
stop for a few days
at any point.

It is always very hot
in the middle of the
day but mornings and
evenings are pleasant.

I hope you are all right.
Of course you are also having
the hot weather.

The hotels and restaurants have
been very good. They serve the
most remarkably extensive dejeunees
I cant manage to eat so much
at that time of day.

I will write again soon
Give my regards to the Townsends
